solution.text:
Given the volume of the pipe = V = 11059.71 \(cm^3\)
The volume of a cylindrical pipe = \(\pi{r_ o}^2h - \pi{r_ i}^2h\)
Let the thickness of the pipe be \(x\)
\(\Rightarrow V = \pi (13)^2 \times 51 - \pi (13-x)^2 \times 51\)
\(\Rightarrow \frac {V}{51\pi}=13^2 - (13-x)^2\)
\(\Rightarrow (13-x)^2 = 169 - \frac{V}{51\pi}\)
\(\Rightarrow x = 13 - 10\)
\(\Rightarrow x = 3\)
Therefore, the thickness of the pipe is 3 cm

= Rs. 4078.8

hint.text:
Remember the following formulas:
Volume of a Cube: \(side^3\)
Surface Area of the Cube:\( 6 \times side^2\)
Volume of a Cuboid: \(length \times breadth \times height\)
Surface Area of the Cube: \(2 \times (lb + bh + lh)\)
Volume of a cylinder:\( \pi r^2h\)
Surface area of a cylinder:\(2\pi r(r+h)\)

solution.text:
Curved surface area (CSA) = \(2\pi rh\)
Total surface area = \(2\pi r (r+h) = 2\pi r^2 + 2\pi rh = 3 \times CSA = 1848\)
Therefore, \(2\pi r^2 + 2\pi rh = 6\pi rh\)
\(\Rightarrow 2\pi r^2 = 4\pi rh\)
\(\Rightarrow r = 2h\)
\(\Rightarrow h = \frac {r}{2}\)
\(CSA = \frac{1848}3 = 2\pi rh = 2\pi r(\frac {r}{2}) = \pi r^2\)
\(\Rightarrow\) Area of Base = \(\pi r^2 = \frac{1848}3\)
\(\Rightarrow r^2 = \frac {1848\times 7}{3\times 22}\)
\(\Rightarrow r = 14 cm\)
\(\Rightarrow h = \frac {r}{2} = 7 cm\)
Therefore, volume \(= \pi r^2h = 4312 cm^3\)

content.text: A solid cylinder has total surface area of 1848 square centimetres. Its curved surface area is one-third of its total surface area. Find the volume of the cylinder

Therefore, number of cubes that can be cut \(= \frac {36^3}{18^3} = 8\) cubes

solution.text:
Area of Polygon = Area of Triangle (1) + Area of Trapezium (2) + Area of Triangle (3) + Area of Triangle (4) + Area of Triangle (5)
\(\frac 12 \times a \times b + \frac 12 (b + e)(c + d) + \frac 12 \times e \times f + \frac 12 \times g \times (d+f) + \frac 12 \times (a+c) \times g\)
\(= \frac 12 \times 18 \times 19 + \frac 12 \times 41.5 \times 28 + \frac 12 \times 22.5 \times 13.5 + \frac 12 \times 18 \times 22.5 + \frac 12 \times 37 \times 18\)
\(=1520.375 cm^2\)

\(= \frac 12 (6 + 8)(4) \times 2\)

solution.text:
Surface Area of the pipe = Curved surface area of outer cylinder + Curved surface area of inner cylinder + Area of both rims
\(= 2\pi {r_ o}h + 2\pi {r_ i}h + 2(\pi {r_ o}^2 - \pi {r_ i}^2)\)
\(= 2\pi \times \frac{23}2 \times 8 + 2 \pi \times \frac{5}2 \times 8 + 2\pi({\frac{23}2}^2 - {\frac{5}2}^2)\)
= 1496\(cm^2\)
Therefore, cost of painting the pipe \(= 1496 \times 0.2\)
= Rs. 299.2

content.text: A cylindrical pipe has an outer diameter of 23 cm and an inner diameter of 5 cm. Its length is 8 cm. It needs to be painted on its outer and inner surfaces, as well as the rims. The cost of painting the pipe is Rs. 0.2 per \(cm^2\). What is the total cost of painting the pipe?

hint.text: Surface Area of the pipe = Curved surface area of outer cylinder + Curved surface area of inner cylinder + Area of both rims

content.text: The dimensions of a cuboid are in the ratio of 6:5:2 (l:b:h). If the total surface area is 1664 \(m^2\). What is the length of the cuboid?
What is the Breadth of the cuboid?

solution.text:
Let length:breadth:height = 6x:5x:2x
Therefore, Surface Area of the cuboid = \(2(6 \times 5x^2 + 5 \times 2x^2 + 2 \times 6x^2)\)
= \(2(52)x^2\)
= \(104x^2\)
Given that surface area is \(1664 m^2\)
Therefore, \(1664 m^2 = 104 x^2\)
\(\Rightarrow x^2 = \frac{1664}{104}\)
\(\Rightarrow x = \sqrt{16}\)
\(\Rightarrow\) x = 4 metres

content.text: What is the Height of the cuboid?

hint.text: Surface Area of the cuboid = \(2 (lb + bh + lh)\)

solution.text:
Given the area \(= \frac 12 \times Width \times\) (Sum of parallel sides)
\(= \frac 12 \times 25 \times (21 +\) River Side Length\()\)
Therefore River Side Length = \(\frac{1012.5}{12.5} - 21\)
\(= 60 m\)

content.text: Hussain bought a plot of agricultural land which is in the shape of a trapezium (see below). The area of the land is \(1012.5 m^2\), the side parallel to the road is 21 metres and the width of the field is 25 metres. How long is the side parallel to the river?

hint.text: The area of a trapezium is \(\frac 12 \times Height \times\) (Sum of parallel sides)

solution.text:
Volume of the brick wall \(= 21 m \times 2 m \times 0.5 m = 21 m^3\)
Volume of one brick \(= 20 cm \times 10 cm \times 5 cm = 1000 cm^3\)
\(1 m^3 = 1000000 cm^3\)
Therefore, number of bricks required \(= 21 \times \frac{1000000}{1000}\)
\(= 21000\)

solution.text:
Total Curved Surface Area = \(2\pi rh = 88 cm^2\)
\(\Rightarrow 2rh = \frac{88}{\pi} = 28 cm^2\)
Once you cut the slice, there are three faces without icing: The curved outer surface and the two rectangular inner surfaces. (Remember that the top and bottom surfaces have icing)
Also, length of Base of Slice = Radius of Cylinder and Height of Slice = Height of Cylinder
Therefore, area of the slice that has no icing
= Curved area of slice + 2 \(\times\) Rectangular surface area of slice
\(= \frac{1}{10}\)(Total Curved Surface Area) + 2 \(\times\) (Base \(\times\) Height of slice)
\(= \frac {1}{10}\times 88 + 2rh\)
\(= \frac {1}{10}\times 88 + 28\)
= 36.8 \(cm^2\)

solution.text:
Volume of cylinder \(= \pi r^2 \times h = \pi \times 10^2 \times 59 = 18542.86 cm^3\)
Volume of new cuboid = \(lbh\) = Volume of cylinder
Therefore, \(lbh = 18542.86 cm^3\)
\(\Rightarrow 32 \times 20 \times h = 18542.86 cm^3\)
\(\Rightarrow h = \frac {18542.86}{32 \times 20} = 28.97\)
The new cuboid is 28.97 cm tall

content.text: A metal cylinder of height 59 cm and radius 10 cm is melted and reshaped into a cuboid of length 32 cm and breadth 20 cm. No metal was wasted during this process. How tall is the new cuboid?

hint.text: If no metal is wasted, both objects will have the same volume.

solution.text:
Total surface area of all the cubes \(= 5 \times 6 \times 1.6^2 = 76.8 cm^2\)
Area of each face =\(1.6^2 cm^2\)
Number of faces that face inward = 10 faces
Therefore, outer surface area = 76.8 - 25.6 = 51.2 \(cm^2\)
Cost of paint = Rs 13 per \(cm^2\)
Therefore, total cost of painting the object = \(51.2 \times 13\)
= Rs. 665.6

\(= 2664 cm^2\)

solution.text:
Cross section of river area = Area of 1 + Area of 2 \(= ac \times \frac 12 (d-c) (a+b) = 124 \times 36 + \frac 12 \times 53\times(124 + 94)\)
\(= 10241 m^2\)
Rate of flow = 5 km/hr = 5000 m/hr
Volume of water flow = Area of cross section \(\times\) Rate of flow
\(= 10241 \times 5000 = 51205000 m^3/hr\)
= 51205 megalitre/hr
One week = 7 days =\( 24 \times 7\) hours = 168 hours
Therefore, volume of water flowing into the sea in one week \(= 168 \times 51205\)
= 8602440 megalitres

content.text: The Vashishti river flows into the Arabian Sea. The cross-section of the river can be approximated as the shape shown in the diagram below. solution.text:
Area of school floor \(= 6720 m^2\)
Area of each tile = \(Base \times height = 15 \times 14 = 210 cm^2\)
Since the tiles can be perfectly broken into smaller parts, the number of tiles required is the area of the floor divided by the area of each tile. Also, remember that \(1m^2 = 10000 cm^2\)
Therefore, Number of tiles = 320000

content.text: You have set up a rain-water harvesting system at your home. A cylindrical container with a radius of 6 dm collects rain-water from your roof. solution.text:
Volume of original tube = \((\pi{r_ o}^2 \times h) - (\pi{r_ i}^2 \times h)\)
\(= 8702.57 cm^3\)
Now, Volume of new tube = Volume of original tube
Let the length of the new tube be x
Therefore,\(V_ {new} = (\pi{r_ o}^2 \times h) - (\pi{r_ i}^2 \times h) = (\pi (\frac {16}{2})^2 \times x) - (\pi (\frac {16}{2} - 5)^2 \times x)\)
\(\Rightarrow x = \frac {V_ {original}}{\pi (\frac {16}2)^2-\pi (\frac {16}2 - m)^2}\)
= 50.35 cm

= 99005.66 g
